t: Jeremiah 48
Judgment on Moab
Against*p Moab. Thus*p says the Lord*s of hosts, the God of Israel: “Woe*pn to Nebo! For*ld it is plundered, Kirjathaim*ld is shamed and*i taken; The*ld high stronghold is shamed and dismayed—
No*ld more praise of Moab. In*ld Heshbon they have devised evil against her: ‘Come,*ld and let us cut her off as a nation.’ You*ld also shall be cut down, O Madmen! The*ld sword shall pursue you;
A*ld voice of crying shall*i be*i from Horonaim: ‘Plundering*ld and great destruction!’
“Moab*ld is destroyed; Her*ld little ones have caused a cry to be heard;
For*ld in the Ascent of Luhith they ascend with continual weeping; For*ld in the descent of Horonaim the enemies have heard a cry of destruction.
“Flee,*ln save your lives! And*ld be like the juniper in the wilderness.
For*ld because you have trusted in your works and your treasures, You*ld also shall be taken. And*ld Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, His*ld priests and his princes together.
And*ld the plunderer shall come against every city; No*ld one shall escape. The*ld valley also shall perish, And*ld the plain shall be destroyed, As*ld the Lord*s has spoken.
“Give*ln wings to Moab, That*ld she may flee and get away; For*ld her cities shall be desolate, Without*ld any to dwell in them.
Cursed*ld is*i he who does the work of the Lord*s deceitfully, And*ld cursed is*i he who keeps back his sword from blood.

“Moab*ln has been at ease from his youth; He*ld has settled on his dregs, And*ld has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, Nor*ld has he gone into captivity. Therefore*ld his taste remained in him, And*ld his scent has not changed.
“Therefore*ln behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord,*s “That*ld I shall send him wine-workers Who*ld will tip him over And*ld empty his vessels And*ld break the bottles.
Moab*ld shall be ashamed of Chemosh, As*ld the house of Israel was ashamed of Bethel, their confidence.
“How*ln can you say, ‘We are*i mighty And*ld strong men for the war’?
Moab*ld is plundered and gone up from*i her cities; Her*ld chosen young men have gone down to the slaughter,” says the King, Whose*ld name is*i the Lord*s of hosts.
“The*ln calamity of Moab is*i near at hand, And*ld his affliction comes quickly.
Bemoan*ld him, all you who are around him; And*ld all you who know his name, Say,*ld ‘How the strong staff is broken, The*ld beautiful rod!’
“O*ln daughter inhabiting Dibon, Come*ld down from your*i glory, And*ld sit in thirst; For*ld the plunderer of Moab has come against you, He*ld has destroyed your strongholds.
O*ld inhabitant of Aroer, Stand*ld by the way and watch; Ask*ld him who flees And*ld her who escapes; Say,*ld ‘What has happened?’
Moab*ld is shamed, for he is broken down. Wail*ld and cry! Tell*ld it in Arnon, that Moab is plundered.
“And*ln judgment has come on the plain country: On*ld Holon and Jahzah and Mephaath,
On*ld Dibon and Nebo and Beth Diblathaim,
On*ld Kirjathaim and Beth Gamul and Beth Meon,
On*ld Kerioth and Bozrah, On*ld all the cities of the land of Moab, Far*ld or near.
The*ld horn of Moab is cut off, And*ld his arm is broken,” says the Lord.*s
“Make*ln him drunk, Because*ld he exalted himself*i against the Lord.*s Moab*ld shall wallow in his vomit, And*ld he shall also be in derision.
For*ld was not Israel a derision to you? Was*ld he found among thieves? For*ld whenever you speak of him, You*ld shake your*i head*i in*i scorn.
You*ld who dwell in Moab, Leave*ld the cities and dwell in the rock, And*ld be like the dove which*i makes her nest In*ld the sides of the cave’s mouth.
“We*ln have heard the pride of Moab (He*ld is*i exceedingly proud), Of*ld his loftiness and arrogance and pride, And*ld of the haughtiness of his heart.”
“I*ln know his wrath,” says the Lord,*s “But*ld it is*i not right; His*ld lies have made nothing right.
Therefore*ld I will wail for Moab, And*ld I will cry out for all Moab; I*ld will mourn for the men of Kir Heres.

O*ld vine of Sibmah! I will weep for you with the weeping of Jazer. Your*ld plants have gone over the sea, They*ld reach to the sea of Jazer. The*ld plunderer has fallen on your summer fruit and your vintage.

Joy*ld and gladness are taken From*ld the plentiful field And*ld from the land of Moab; I*ld have caused wine to fail from the winepresses; No*ld one will tread with joyous shouting— Not*ld joyous shouting!
“From*ln the cry of Heshbon to Elealeh and to Jahaz They*ld have uttered their voice, From*ld Zoar to Horonaim, Like*ild a three-year-old heifer; For*ld the waters of Nimrim also shall be desolate.
“Moreover,”*ln says the Lord,*s “I*ld will cause to cease in Moab The*ld one who offers sacrifices*i in the high places And*ld burns incense to his gods.
Therefore*ld My heart shall wail like flutes for Moab, And*ld like flutes My heart shall wail For*ld the men of Kir Heres. Therefore*ld the riches they have acquired have perished.
“For*ln every head shall*i be*i bald, and every beard clipped; On*ld all the hands shall*i be*i cuts, and on the loins sackcloth—
A*ld general lamentation On*ld all the housetops of Moab, And*ld in its streets; For*ld I have broken Moab like a vessel in which is*i no pleasure,” says the Lord.*s
“They*ld shall wail: ‘How*ld she is broken down! How*ld Moab has turned her back with shame!’ So*ld Moab shall be a derision And*ld a dismay to all those about her.”
For*p thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn one shall fly like an eagle, And*ld spread his wings over Moab.
Kerioth*ld is taken, And*ld the strongholds are surprised; The*ld mighty men’s hearts in Moab on that day shall be Like*ld the heart of a woman in birth pangs.
And*ld Moab shall be destroyed as a people, Because*ld he exalted himself*i against the Lord.*s
Fear*ld and the pit and the snare shall*i be*i upon you, O*ld inhabitant of Moab,” says the Lord.*s

“He*ld who flees from the fear shall fall into the pit, And*ld he who gets out of the pit shall be caught in the snare. For*ld upon Moab, upon it I will bring The*ld year of their punishment,” says the Lord.*s

“Those*ln who fled stood under the shadow of Heshbon Because*ld of exhaustion. But*ld a fire shall come out of Heshbon, A*ld flame from the midst of Sihon, And*ld shall devour the brow of Moab, The*ld crown of the head of the sons of tumult.
Woe*ld to you, O Moab! The*ld people of Chemosh perish; For*ld your sons have been taken captive, And*ld your daughters captive.
“Yet*ld I will bring back the captives of Moab In*ld the latter days,” says the Lord.*s Thus*p far is*i the judgment of Moab.
